content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Given a DataFrame df_cars with column `model`, write a function `count_model_rows` that groups data by model and calculate how many rows there are for each.

Here is an example function in Julia:

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function count_model_rows(df::DataFrame)
    df_counts = groupby(df, :model) |> @summarize(n=length(model))
end
```

This function groups the rows in your dataframe by `model` column and then calculates the length of each group (i.e., number of rows for each model). The result is returned as a new DataFrame with columns `model` and `n`. 

You can call it on an existing DataFrame as follows:
```julia
count_model_rows(df_cars)
```
